result.execSummary:
The defendant Brooke M. Copa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland by the end of the business day on 4/11/16!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes:
The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.
  Def is to obtain anger management counseling and to complete recommended treatment;  with the Def finding the funding for such counseling.

NO ABUSIVE CONTACT WITH  R.A.K.
  Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

timeConds.notes:
5 days jail or 40 hours uncompensated community service; if the defendant chooses to complete the community service it must be done in its entirety within the first 60 days of probation to avoid jail. Partial credit will not be given. If the defendant fails to complete the community service, she must serve the entire 5 days of conditional jail time. Written proof of successful completion of community service must be provided to the Court, the Department of Corrections, the Ashland County Jail, and the Ashland County District Attrorney's office, on the letterhead of the nonprofit agency for whcih the service was performed prior to the 60 day deadline.
Defendant granted credit for time served

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brooke M. Copa

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to Ct from DOC re:  request for early discharge

Defendant Brooke M. Copa in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Does not want an atty- no threat or force to give up atty- wrote letter to ct for early release from probation. Def comments did everyhting she had to do, would like to be released from probation. Went on probation in April. Agreed with what the court ordered. did 7 months of probation. Does not have anything that everything is complete. Ct would like this verified. DA comments did talk to  probation agent- did everything she needed to do and good job- DA comments its great to see people do what the y need to do when they have to , but also follow through with the agreement that was set forth before. CT asks def is she asked probation to release her early. she comments that she did, but that the final dec. was up tp the judge. Back on record. Ct comments Probation can release you early. Ct can do this as well. Ct questions def why she wants to be released early- she didnt even know it was a option until she saw a booklit on it. Def comments she travels a lot. See's agent every 3 months. Did an excellent job on probation. Ct grants request  Kelly Mcknight makes comment they talked about a shorter period of probation but this case could have been a felony so that is why they came to the agreement of 12 months.  DA comments supreme court has order that court can not change the length of probation. Judge does not have Statuetory athorit. to change probation. CT does NOT grant motion at this time- remain on probation will rec letter from ct 
C
Motion hearing on November 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
from Atty req to move hearing to 2:00, def has conflict w/1:00 time (head start program).  Ok by Judge

Defendant Brooke M. Copa in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No agreemt yet, req adjmt.  Status conference scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Attorney Mark L Perrine in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  MLP feels close to resolving...req adjmt.  DAP  Status conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Attorney Mark L Perrine in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Close, req adjmt.  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
